name: NPR
text: If 95% of Americans wore masks in public, it could drastically reduce the amount of COVID-19 deaths by February, the study projects. https://t.co/PPzXfebSPC

name: NPR
text:
Ibram X. Kendi: "Life is about the choices that you make in any given moment. So, when you make a racist choice, you're being racist. When you choose in a particular moment to ... challenge that racist idea or policy, you're being anti-racist." 
https://t.co/glXbRN4id1

name: NPR
text:
With the latest in her series of football-themed romances, Alexa Martin crafts a heart-warming love story full of laughter and sensuality â€” and doesn't fumble in delivering a hard-hitting plot, our reviewer says.

name: NPR
text:
Bryan Washington's debut novel follows an eclectic cast of characters who redefine family. He says he wanted to write about people "operating from a place of love for one another, as opposed to disdain or hatred." 
https://t.co/slqidq8lJv

name: NPR
text:
Rural communities in the U.S. were largely spared in the early months of the pandemic.

Now, they're experiencing some of the country's worst outbreaks.

"Rural is not a refuge," one public expert says.
https://t.co/IGLB15JTp3

name: NPR
text: Margo Price's new album rocks, which might surprise fans who grew to love the Americana star for her crystalline country voice. https://t.co/WrCmVqqQcR

name: NPR
text:
Kazim Ali's new poetry collection was inspired by the story of Sheila Chandra, a well-known singer rendered voiceless by an incurable neurological condition.
https://t.co/Da83P996DA
